channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP (APM)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP (APM)

item.title: CVE-2019-6591|2024-08-04T20:23:22.223Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: On BIG-IP APM 14.0.0 to 14.0.0.4, 13.0.0 to 13.1.1.3 and 12.1.0 to 12.1.3.7, a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in the resource information page for authenticated users when a full webtop is configured on the BIG-IP APM system.

item.title: CVE-2019-6596|2024-08-04T20:23:22.030Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: In BIG-IP 14.0.0-14.0.0.2, 13.0.0-13.1.1.1, 12.1.0-12.1.3.6, 11.6.1-11.6.3.2, or 11.5.1-11.5.8, when processing fragmented ClientHello messages in a DTLS session TMM may corrupt memory eventually leading to a crash. Only systems offering DTLS connections via APM are impacted.

item.title: CVE-2019-6595|2024-08-04T20:23:22.109Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in F5 BIG-IP Access Policy Manager (APM) 11.5.x and 11.6.x Admin Web UI.
